sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using QR decomposition
message_1:
Given the following system of linear equations:

2x + 3y - z = 4
x - y + 2z = 3
4x + y + z = 2

Express the solution vector as a linear combination of the columns of the matrix A, where A is the coefficient matrix of the system. Perform the QR decomposition of A and use it to solve the system.
message_2:
First, let's write the system of linear equations in matrix form Ax = b, where A is the coefficient matrix, x is the solution vector, and b is the constant vector.

A = | 2  3 -1 |
    | 1 -1  2 |
    | 4  1  1 |

x = | x |
    | y |
    | z |

b = | 4 |
    | 3 |
    | 2 |

Now, we need to perform the QR decomposition of A. The QR decomposition is a factorization of A into an orthogonal matrix Q and an upper triangular matrix R.

Using the Gram-Schmidt process, we can find the orthogonal basis for the column space of A:

Let a1, a2, and a3 be the columns of A.

a1 = | 2 |
     | 1 |
     | 4 |

a2 = | 3  |
     | -1 |
     | 1  |

a3 = | -1 |
     |  2 |
     |  1 |

Now, we find the orthogonal vectors q1, q2, and q3:

q1 = a1 / ||a1|| = | 2/√21 | = |  2/√21  |
                      | 1/√21 |   |  1/√21  |
                      | 4/√21 |   |  4/√21  |

q2 = (a2 - (a2·q1)q1) / ||a2 - (a2·q1)q1||

a2·q1 = 3(2/√21) - 1(1/√21) + 1(4/√21) = 9/√21

q2 = (a2 - (9/√21)q1) / ||a2 - (9/√21)q1||

q2 = |  3/√105 | = |  3/√105  |
     | -8/√105 |   | -8/√105  |
     | -1/√105 |   | -1/√105  |

q3 = (a3 - (a3·q1)q1 - (a3·q2)q2) / ||a3 - (a3·q1)q1 - (a3·q2)q2||

a3·q1 = -1(2/√21) + 2(1/√21) + 1(4/√21) = 4/√21
a3·q2 = -1(3/√105) + 2(-8/√105) + 1(-1/√105) = -19/√105

q3 = (a3 - (4/√21)q1 - (-19/√105)q2) / ||a3 - (4/√21)q1 - (-19/√105)q2||

q3 = |  1/√35 | = |  1/√35  |
     |  4/√35 |   |  4/√35  |
     | -2/√35 |   | -2/√35  |

Now, we have the orthogonal matrix Q:

Q = |  2/√21   3/√105   1/√35  |
    |  1/√21  -8/√105   4/√35  |
    |  4/√21  -1/√105  -2/√35  |

Next, we find the upper triangular matrix R:

R = Q^T * A

R = |  21/√21   -9/√105   4/√35  |
    |   0       105/√105 -19/√35  |
    |   0         0       35/√35  |

R = |  1  -3/5  2/5  |
    |  0   1   -1/5  |
    |  0   0    1   |

Now, we can solve the system using the QR decomposition:

Ax = b => QRx = b => Rx = Q^T * b

Let's compute Q^T * b:

Q^T * b = |  2/√21   1/√21   4/√21  | | 4 |
          |  3/√105 -8/√105 -1/√105 | | 3 |
          |  1/√35   4/√35  -2/√35  | | 2 |

Q^T * b = |  6/√21 |
          | -1/√105 |
          |  2/√35  |

Now, we can solve the upper triangular system Rx = Q^T * b:

|  1  -3/5  2/5  | | x |   |  6/√21  |
|  0   1   -1/5  | | y | = | -1/√105 |
|  0   0    1   | | z |   |  2/√35  |

From the last row, we have:

z = 2/√35

From the second row, we have:

y - (1/5)z = -1/√105 => y = -1/√105 + (1/5)(2/√35) => y = 1/3

From the first row, we have:

x - (3/5)y + (2/5)z = 6/√21 => x = 6/√21 + (3/5)(1/3) - (2/5)(2/√35) => x = 2/3

So, the solution vector x is:

x = | 2/3 |
    | 1/3 |
    | 2/√35 |

Now, we can express the solution vector x as a linear combination of the columns of the matrix A:

x = (2/3)a1 + (1/3)a2 + (2/√35)a3

x = (2/3)| 2 | + (1/3)| 3 | + (2/√35)| -1 |
    | 1 |       | -1 |       |  2 |
    | 4 |       | 1  |       |  1 |
